17   | /**
18   |  * Parses JSON data and returns the data in tree form.
19   |  *
20   |  * Writtan by Florian Forster
21   |  *
22   |  * August 2010
23   |  *
24   |  * This interface makes quick parsing and extraction of smallish JSON docs
25   |  * trivial, as shown in the following example:
26   |  *
27   |  * +html+ <a href="../../example/parse_config.c.html#file">example/parse_config.c</a><br>
28   |  * +html+ <hr>
29   |  **/
30   | 
31   | #ifndef YAJL_TREE_H
32   | #define YAJL_TREE_H 1
33   | 
34   | #include <yajl/yajl_common.h>
35   | 
36   | #ifdef __cplusplus
37   | extern "C" {
38   | #endif
39   | 
40   | /*+ possible data types that a yajl_val_s can hold +*/
41   | typedef enum {
42   |     yajl_t_string = 1,
43   |     yajl_t_number = 2,
44   |     yajl_t_object = 3,
45   |     yajl_t_array = 4,
46   |     yajl_t_true = 5,
47   |     yajl_t_false = 6,
48   |     yajl_t_null = 7,
49   |     /*+
50   |      * The <any> type isn't valid for yajl_val_s.type, but can be
51   |      * used as an argument to routines like yajl_tree_get().
52   |      +*/
53   |     yajl_t_any = 8
54   | } yajl_type;
55   | 
56   | #define YAJL_NUMBER_INT_VALID    0x01
57   | #define YAJL_NUMBER_DOUBLE_VALID 0x02
58   | 
59   | /*+ A pointer to a node in the parse tree +*/
60   | typedef struct yajl_val_s * yajl_val;
61   | 
62   | /*+
63   |  * A JSON value representation capable of holding one of the seven
64   |  * types above. For "string", "number", "object", and "array"
65   |  * additional data is available in the union.  The "YAJL_IS_*"
66   |  * and "YAJL_GET_*" macros below allow type checking and convenient
67   |  * value extraction.
68   |  +*/
69   | struct yajl_val_s
70   | {
71   |     /*+
72   |      * Type of the value contained. Use the "YAJL_IS_*" macros to check for a
73   |      * specific type.
74   |      +*/
75   |     yajl_type type;
76   |     /*+
77   |      * Type-specific data. You may use the "YAJL_GET_*" macros to access these
78   |      * members.
79   |      +*/
80   |     union
81   |     {
82   |         char * string;
83   |         struct {
84   |             long long i; /*+ integer value, if representable. +*/
85   |             double  d;   /*+ double value, if representable. +*/
86   |             char   *r;   /*+ unparsed number in string form. +*/
87   |             /*+
88   |              * Signals whether the \em i and \em d members are
89   |              * valid. See \c YAJL_NUMBER_INT_VALID and
90   |              * \c YAJL_NUMBER_DOUBLE_VALID.
91   |              +*/
92   |             unsigned int flags;
93   |         } number;
94   |         struct {
95   |             const char **keys; /*+ Array of keys +*/
96   |             yajl_val *values; /*+ Array of values. +*/
97   |             size_t len; /*+ Number of key-value-pairs. +*/
98   |         } object;
99   |         struct {
100  |             yajl_val *values; /*+ Array of elements. +*/
101  |             size_t len; /*+ Number of elements. +*/
102  |         } array;
103  |     } u;
104  | };
105  | 
106  | YAJL_API yajl_val yajl_tree_parse (const char *input,
107  |                                    char *error_buffer, size_t error_buffer_size);
108  | YAJL_API void yajl_tree_free (yajl_val v);
109  | YAJL_API yajl_val yajl_tree_get(yajl_val parent, const char ** path, yajl_type type);
110  | 
111  | /* Various convenience macros to check the type of a `yajl_val` */
112  | #define YAJL_IS_STRING(v) (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_string))
113  | #define YAJL_IS_NUMBER(v) (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_number))
114  | #define YAJL_IS_INTEGER(v) (YAJL_IS_NUMBER(v) && ((v)->u.number.flags & YAJL_NUMBER_INT_VALID))
115  | #define YAJL_IS_DOUBLE(v) (YAJL_IS_NUMBER(v) && ((v)->u.number.flags & YAJL_NUMBER_DOUBLE_VALID))
116  | #define YAJL_IS_OBJECT(v) (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_object))
117  | #define YAJL_IS_ARRAY(v)  (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_array ))
118  | #define YAJL_IS_TRUE(v)   (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_true  ))
119  | #define YAJL_IS_FALSE(v)  (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_false ))
120  | #define YAJL_IS_NULL(v)   (((v) != NULL) && ((v)->type == yajl_t_null  ))
121  | 
122  | /*+ Given a yajl_val_string return a ptr to the bare string it contains,
123  |  *  or NULL if the value is not a string. +*/
124  | #define YAJL_GET_STRING(v) (YAJL_IS_STRING(v) ? (v)->u.string : NULL)
125  | 
126  | /*+ Get the string representation of a number.  You should check type first,
127  |  *  perhaps using YAJL_IS_NUMBER +*/
128  | #define YAJL_GET_NUMBER(v) ((v)->u.number.r)
129  | 
130  | /*+ Get the double representation of a number.  You should check type first,
131  |  *  perhaps using YAJL_IS_DOUBLE +*/
132  | #define YAJL_GET_DOUBLE(v) ((v)->u.number.d)
133  | 
134  | /*+ Get the 64bit (long long) integer representation of a number.  You should
135  |  *  check type first, perhaps using YAJL_IS_INTEGER +*/
136  | #define YAJL_GET_INTEGER(v) ((v)->u.number.i)
137  | 
138  | /*+ Get a pointer to a yajl_val_object or NULL if the value is not an object. +*/
139  | #define YAJL_GET_OBJECT(v) (YAJL_IS_OBJECT(v) ? &(v)->u.object : NULL)
140  | 
141  | /*+ Get a pointer to a yajl_val_array or NULL if the value is not an object. +*/
142  | #define YAJL_GET_ARRAY(v)  (YAJL_IS_ARRAY(v)  ? &(v)->u.array  : NULL)
143  | 
144  | #ifdef __cplusplus
145  | }
146  | #endif
147  | 
148  | #endif /* YAJL_TREE_H */
